page.title: 08Life in Britwell
page.content: Mrs Carrington told us about living in Britwell today. She said Britwell was a friendly community. There is not much transport. A coach which costs 50p return goes to Watlington every Friay. The nearest shops, chemists, vets, doctors are in Watlinton and people in the village especially old people rely a lot on friends and neighbours. One of the advantages of living in the village is that there is lots of entertainment, barn dances, pig roasts, Harvest supper, chuch fete, firewoks on bonfire night, swimming. There is a youth club and cricket club. As there is not much traffic the village is quiet and pictuesque. Most jobs today are in farming or housekeeping. The childen go to school in Watlington. The nearest playgroup is in Watlington too. Britwell not changed in 20 years
